cut.author: 笨笨虎
cut.content: 我打过12345，投诉完后，还会有电话回访，问你问题解决没，而且速度很快，这个一定要点赞

cut.author: Max Li
cut.content: “12345” is a magic number in China, if you ever travel to China and have some issues or face some problems, try calling this number, 99% of problems will get solved super fast for sure.

cut.author: Sze Hian Yap
cut.content: Thank you for presenting a genuine picture of long deviated facts about a socialist capital. 👍👍👍👍👍👍🙏🙏🙏🙏🍷

cut.author: JIMMY
cut.content: I think when a foreigner go to China or knowing China more it actually opened their mind.

cut.author: Dennis Chen
cut.content: My uncle called same hotline in Shanghai, complained abt the tree out of his window being too tall. And they actually came in the next 3 days to investigate and fixed the problem quickly.

cut.author: Simon Lin
cut.content: China is way more open than the west claims.

cut.author: 裴军
cut.content: 我没有打过这个电话，但是在政府公开信箱里投诉过工地机械噪音扰民，第二天噪音就消失了，本来我还以为是工地不需要再使用哪种机械呢，过了几天接到了城建还是什么单位的回访电话，询问噪音问题有没有改善什么的，才知道相关部门第二天就跑到工地对噪音扰民提出告知和整改通知了。只是我第一次感觉政府居然这么有效率。

cut.author: kylian baccon
cut.content: I just come from Toutiao, and I'm here to support you on youtube…… Ignore those trash talks from western media. Continue your good work！

cut.author: HazzaChinaVlogs
cut.content: I have also used this hotline to solve a number of issues I've faced in Guangzhou over the years. I made a video about it about a month ago, too. It is useful for solving day-to-day livelihood issues - sometimes you do just need a mediator, or someone in the middle, to solve problems, and this hotline provides that. Each time I've used it they have been very quick in providing a response & solutions.

cut.author: Pinned by
cut.content: As it seems, although you cannot publicly ostracise the Chinese government in public in China, there are certain means where you can have your voice heard. Did you know this about China? Does this alter your perception at all about China?
